docreader.list

Class ListReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • docreader.list.ListReader

  • public final class ListReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Full featured ListReader which takes care of independent multilevel lists, pseudo consecutive lists, pseudo / fake list paragraphs and other such niceties.
    In other words: This transforms a plain list number text as received from MS Word into a usable tracestring.
    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  ListReader.FakeLsidManager
      Manages crafted List-IDs necessary for paragraphs which are technically not in a list but need to behave as if they were Note: There should be only one instance of this class for each document
      private static class  ListReader.SublistStack
      Manages a stack of all our sublist managers; will grow larger for lists nested in tables

    • Method Detail

      • processParagraph

        public void processParagraph(org.apache.poi.hwpf.usermodel.Paragraph paragraph)
        Process a single paragraph

        Note: This must be called consecutively for every paragraph in the document (with the exception of paragraphs in tables and possibly other nested structures)

        Results may be obtained via getAsPrinted(), getFullyQualified() and getParent(RequirementRoot) afterwards.

        Parameters:
        paragraph - Paragraph to process
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null

      • processParagraphPlain

        public java.lang.String processParagraphPlain(ParagraphListAware paragraphListAware)
        Process a single paragraph; special case when no only the resulting numberText is relevant and nothing else
        Parameters:
        paragraphListAware - Paragraph to process
        Returns:
        a String containing the numberText, never null

      • injectListItem

        public void injectListItem(java.lang.Integer lsid,
                           int ilvl,
                           java.lang.String numberText)
        Inject an arbitrary item into any list

        Notes:

        1. This assumes the item has no left indentation and is at olvl == 1, see SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer#ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer().
        2. Use this with utmost care. Basically this is a dirty hack to somehow squeeze arbitrary stuff into this manager. Side effects might not be what you expected...

        Parameters:
        lsid - (fake) lsid of the injected item or null if this should become an independent list
        ilvl - (fake) ilvl of the injected item
        numberText - (fake) numberText of the injected item
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the arguments is null

      • getAsPrinted

        public java.lang.String getAsPrinted()
        Get the list number as it is displayed in the original input file (i.e. not qualified)
        Returns:
        The number string for this list item as it is printed out by MS Word; never null

      • getFullyQualified

        public java.lang.String getFullyQualified()
        Obtain a list number text which is suitable for use as a trace string
        Returns:
        The fully qualified number string for this list item; never null

      • getFullyQualifiedSkippedLevels

        public java.lang.String[] getFullyQualifiedSkippedLevels()
        Returns:
        an ordered array of strings with all the skipped levels which must be inserted before the current item to generate a proper hierarchy; never null

      • getParent

        public RequirementRoot getParent(RequirementRoot input)
        Determine the correct parent of the current requirement to build a tree structure; must be called after each call to processParagraph(Paragraph) and injectListItem(Integer, int, String)

        Note: If there are placeholder requirements (i.e. skipped levels) this will return the parent of the very first placeholder. All subsequent placeholders and the actual list item will be first-level children of that first placeholder.

        Parameters:
        input - previous requirement
        Returns:
        parent of the current requirement; never null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is null

      • getLevelDifference

        public int getLevelDifference()
        Returns:
        a numerical value to describe the hierarchical relationship between the previous requirement and the current one
        See Also:
        SublistManager.getLevelDifference()

      • getTableNestingLevel

        public int getTableNestingLevel()
        Returns:
        the current sublist table nesting level (1-based)

      • addNestingLevel

        public void addNestingLevel(RequirementRoot hrParent,
                            org.apache.poi.hwpf.usermodel.Range range,
                            NestingType nestingType)
        Add a new nesting level
        Parameters:
        hrParent - umbrella requirement of this nesting level (i.e. all requirements inside this nesting will be children of this)
        range - range which covers the entire nested part
        nestingType - the type of the new nested structure
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameters is null or invalid

      • removeNestingLevel

        public void removeNestingLevel()
        Remove the last added nesting level

      • getRange

        public org.apache.poi.hwpf.usermodel.Range getRange()
        Returns:
        the currently active range with respect to any nesting

      • getHRParent

        RequirementRoot getHRParent()
        Returns:
        the currently active parent requirement for the tracestring-generation
